Arts Features

Hues of Hockney

Jack Davies takes a look at the twists and turns of David Hockney's glowing career

Art Fan VS Fan Art

Eliza hunton reckons it's time we start to recognise the real art at the heart of fan art

A Stitch in Time

Tessa Layzelle talks to Lara Medlam about her 'modern quilts': what they are, how she makes them, and why they matter

Pressing Matters

Hannah Sackville-Bryant contemplates the renaissance of traditional letterpress printing

Knockin' on Dylan's Door

Jack Davies offers his thoughts on Bob Dylan's failure to acknowledge his Nobel Prize

Happy Mediums

Lara Medlam speaks to artist Belinda Syme about her eclectic approach and the centrality of memory and imagination in her work

Panoptical illusions

Liam Mullally speaks to artist Jess Johnson about world building, her fascination with 1980s sci-fi and bringing her work to virtual reality

Lost in adaptation

Jaz Hayward considers whether we should regret the adaptation of classic children's literature beyond the book

Let's get physical

In an era of digital cameras, Jack Richardson considers whether we should be returning to film stock

Edinburgh Fringe 2016: Ada/ Ava Q&A

Liam Mullally talks to director Drew Dir about the UK debut of his shadow puppet based production, Ada/ Ava

Edinburgh Fringe 2016: Blush Q&A

Munisha Lall speaks to Blush director, Edward Stambollouian, about his production of Charlotte Josephine's play

Edinburgh Fringe 2016: Katie Brennan Q&A

Munisha Lall talks to Katie Brennan ahead of her new show, Quarter Life Crisis

Festivals 2016: Latitude Festival - Milton Jones and Bill Bailey join Comedy bill

Fringe favourites Katherine Ryan and Marcus Brigstocke also set to appear at July's festival

Festivals 2016: Latitude Festival Preview - Theatre, Film and Cabaret

Check out the best arts entertainment on offer at the UK's most diverse and dynamic festival

Arsethetic

In light of the Turner Prize nominations, Deborah Lam looks at the current state of art

Hyde and Seek

The cast and crew of Hyde Park talk to Ella Barker about warring couples

The Young Ones

Christian Jackson thinks we shouldn't dwell on age when assessing the life's work of a poet

Soap Opera

Composer Mark Simpson talks to Rory Kelly about his new show Pleasure, set in a gay club toilet

Donald's trunk

Liam Mullally questions whether political art measures up in the age of social media

Plain Jane

As Charlotte Bronte's bicentenary is celebrated, Liz Foster remembers her most famous heroine

Get Owt

Say Owt organiser Henry Raby speaks to Liam Mullally about York International Women's festival, Sophia Walker and art's place in protest

Shia surprise

After his brief stint occupying an Oxford Union lift, Liam Mullally asks whether we should start to take Shia LeBeouf more seriously

Electronic Arts

Jack Richardson treads the fine line between man-made and machine art

One foot in the grave

The crew of experimental production A Matter of Life and Death talk to Ella Barker about York's independent and underground theatre

Cutting Corners

In wake of the V&A's recent decision to hire all staff under their private wing, Holly Woolnough discusses the government cuts to arts funding

A long Wei to go

Munisha Lall discusses artist and activist Ai Weiwei's responses to the refugee crisis

Redeeming 'High Art'

In a world where people would rather spend an evening with Netflix, Jonny Clowes makes the case for opera and ballet

Less is Nimura

Cartoonist Daisuke Nimura talks to Jack Richardson about Austrian Expressionism, his favourite films and the difficulties of animation

War of words

Rory Kelly takes a look at the poetry of the jihadist groups whose ideologies have been spreading chaos across the Middle East
